snippet: A preacher known as Abu Qatada, who was convicted in absentia for his involvement in terrorist bombing plots, has been under restriction in Britain for more than a decade.
abstract: British authorities resume protracted effort to send Muslim cleric Omar Mahmoud Mohammed Othman to Jordan to face charges; Othman, also known as Abu Qatada,  was convicted in absentia for his involvement in terrorist bombing plots and has been under restriction in Britain for more than a decade.
lead_paragraph: A preacher known as Abu Qatada, who was convicted in absentia for his involvement in terrorist bombing plots, has been under restriction in Britain for more than a decade.

headline.seo: Britain Resumes Bid to Send Abu Qatada to Jordan to Face Charges
headline.main: Britain Resumes Bid to Send Cleric to Jordan to Face Terror Charges
headline.print_headline: Britain Resumes Bid to Send Cleric to Jordan to Face Terror Charges
